title: Dying Light: The Beast Update Introduces Nightmare Experience
description: If you've been looking for more of a challenge from Dying Light: The Beast, then you're about to get it. Developer Techland has dropped Update 1.5 for Dying Light: The Beast, and it's giving players the chance to test their skills in the Nightmare Experience. To turn up the heat on players, human and infected enemies are now smarter, more aggressive, significantly stronger, and more reactive to the players' actions. Volatiles may now even appear during the day in some of the Dark Zones, and players have far fewer resources to deal with them all. If that wasn't enough, there's a new super enemy, the Alpha Volatile. Techland calls it "the most intelligent Volatile in the history of Dying Light." It's even smarter than the traditional Volatiles and its heightened senses can track the player across the entire map unless they reach a safe zone. The Alpha Volatiles can be killed, but good luck trying to pull that off. At night, the player is the prey for this creature. Players can also get new finishing maneuvers, including one-handed blunt weapons and one-handed slashing weapons. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: It: Welcome To Derry 4K Steelbook Preorders Restocked At Amazon
description: It: Welcome to Derry - Season 1 Steelbook Edition (4K Blu-ray) $45 | Releases May 5, 2026 Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Gruv Preorder at Walmart It: Welcome to Derry - Season 1 (Blu-ray) $35 | Releases May 5, 2026 Preorder at Amazon Season 1 of HBO Max's It prequel series dances its way onto 4K Blu-ray, Blu-ray, and DVD on May 5, 2026. Preorders for the It: Welcome to Derry Limited Edition Steelbook initially sold out in hours, but it's back in stock at Amazon for $45 and Walmart for $57. If you're a Stephen King fan, it'd probably be wise to preorder ASAP. Steelbook Editions of the two-part It film adaptation sold out fast, and Welcome to Derry is the first TV series based on a Stephen King novel to get a 4K Blu-ray edition. At this time, the Limited Edition Steelbook is the only way to get the series on 4K Blu-ray. Welcome to Derry: Season 1 is available to stream in full on HBO Max. Alternatively, you can buy Season 1 on other streaming platforms like Amazon Prime Video for $22. Welcome to Derry holds an 80% on Rotten Tomatoes, and I think many longtime fans of King's legendary horror novel would say Season 1 was pretty great. HBO has yet to renew the series for a second season, but director Andy Muschietti has a three-season arc in mind. Season 1 tells the story of Pennywise's reign of terror in 1962. Season 2 would rewind the clock 27 years to Pennywise's previous feeding cycle in 1935, and Season 3 would be set in 1908. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: This Motorized Arcade Game Building Set Could Be A Fun Holiday Gift
description: Sosuy Motorized Coin Pusher Arcade Game Building Set (2,093 pieces) $61.74 (was $80) See at Amazon If you're looking for a last-minute Christmas gift, check out the Motorized Coin Pusher Arcade Game Building Set on sale at Amazon. Available for $61.74 (was $80), it lets you build a functional replica of the fun coin pushing games found at the arcade. This is the first real discount we've seen for the product, and it looks like a neat project to work on over the holidays. Sosuy Motorized Coin Pusher Arcade Game Building Set (2,093 pieces) $61.74 (was $80) While kids will have fun playing with the Coin Pusher Arcade Game once the build is complete, they'll probably need an adult to help snap together its 2,093 pieces. Not only are there a lot of pieces, but the kit features a bunch of moving parts that likely require a skilled hand to get working properly. For example, the finished game features a movable coin slot, a rotatable switch, and an electric motor drive. In other words, parents can have fun constructing the complex machine alongside their kids, making it a cool winter activity for the whole family. Once the building is done, the machine comes with everything you need to start playing like you're at the arcade, including dozens of durable plastic coins. See at Amazon The completed machine stands nearly 17 inches tall and 11 inches wide, making it a pretty robust project. It looks quite premium, too, with a retro yellow-and-red design and a little "Coin" marquee at the top by the coin slot. While the brand, Sosuy, doesn't have the name recognition of Lego, it's responsible for some unique building kits. Beyond this game, it sells a Bumper Cars Building Set featuring movable vehicles. It's also on sale ahead of the holidays, now just $48.44 (was $60) at Amazon. And though it's not discounted, the Water Slide Building Set offers a colorful design, a slidable track, a functioning chain to move its passengers, and spans nearly two feet when completed. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Get All 5 Mad Max Films On 4K Blu-Ray For Under $50
description: Mad Max 5-Film Collection (4K Blu-ray) $49.49 (was $80) See at Amazon Nothing beats finding a freshly wrapped 4K Blu-ray box set under the Christmas tree, and if you're looking to spoil someone who enjoys "Ozsploitation" movies, then check out this limited-time deal on the entire Mad Max film saga. This 4K Blu-ray bundle launched for $100 last year, but it's now discounted to its lowest price yet at $49.49 on Amazon. It also comes with digital copies of all five movies. This is an awesome deal on one of the most acclaimed action film series, but the price cut ends until 11:59 PM PT, so you only have a few more hours to take advantage of the deal. Mad Max 5-Film Collection (4K Blu-ray) $49.49 (was $80) Set in a dystopian future where society has broken down in the wake of resource and water wars, the box set includes Mad Max, Mad Max: The Road Warrior, Mad Max: Beyond Thunderdome, Mad Max: Fury Road, and Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga. The slipcase also pays tribute to the film series, featuring artwork showcasing various images of the bandits and the vehicles that hunted down Max and Furiosa throughout each movie. This collection includes a curated selection of special features pulled from previous Blu-ray releases. You can sit down for several behind-the-scenes documentaries, deleted scenes, and featurettes that explore the chaotic world of the film series. What makes this edition special is that it is the only 4K Blu-ray box set to include the physical Black & Chrome editions of Fury Road and Furiosa. Both movies look stunning in black and white, as each film was re-graded to create striking images bereft of color. The only downside to this collection is that there are no special features included for Beyond Thunderdome. Mad Max fans will be used to this, since no bonus materials were included on the original DVD or on standard Blu-ray copies of the film. See at Amazon Mad Max 5-Film LocationMad Max 5-Film Collection Special Features Mad Max Mad Max: The Film Phenomenon Mad Max: The Road Warrior Road War: The Making of The Road Warrior Introduction by Leonard Maltin Audio Commentary with director George Miller and cinematographer Dean Semler Mad Max: Fury Road Black & Chrome Edition Introduction by George Miller The Tools of the Wasteland The Road Warriors: Max and Furiosa Mad Max: Fury on Four Wheels Maximum Fury: Filming Fury Road Fury Road: Crash & Smash The Five Wives: So Shiny, So Chrome Deleted Scenes Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga Highway to Valhalla: In Pursuit of Furiosa Darkest Angel: Anya Taylor-Joy as Furiosa Motorbike Messiah: Chris Hemsworth as Dementus Furiosa: Stowaway to Nowhere Metal Beasts & Holy Motors Black & Chrome Edition Introduction by George Miller If Mad Max appeals to you, then you'll also want to check out this brand-new 4K Blu-ray bundle of classic action and comedy movies. The Totally Awesome '80s bundle is available for $55, and it includes Top Gun, Trading Places, The Untouchables, Beverly Hills Cop, and Ferris Bueller's Day Off. Considered among the greatest blockbusters of that decade, each film also comes with a digital streaming copy and special features. Totally Awesome 80s (4K Blu-ray) $55 | Releases December 16 See at Amazon For even more vintage action, you can add The James Bond Collection of 24-film Blu-rays for only $55 (was $120), or if you're in the mood for some horror, the Amazon-exclusive Steelbook Edition of The Dead Zone on 4K Blu-ray is available for its lowest price yet. The Halloween 4K steelbooks and bundles have also been substantially discounted, and Amazon's massive sale on Shout Factory movies offers dozens of great 4K titles at low prices. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Hogwarts Legacy Just Did Something Only A Small Group Of Games Ever Have
description: The Harry Potter game Hogwarts Legacy has now sold more than 40 million copies worldwide, making it among the best-selling games of all time. Warner Bros. Games made the announcement today, December 17, amid its parent company Warner Bros. Discovery's sale to Netflix, or Paramount. At 40 million sales, the game is a smash hit, but not quite close enough to break into the top 10 best-selling games ever. Hogwarts Legacy was developed by Avalanche Software and published by Warner Bros. Games through its Portkey Games label, which handles Harry Potter games for the company. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Game Awards Reaches New Viewership Milestone In 2025, Higher Than Super Bowl Numbers
description: The Game Awards had another strong year in 2025, with host and organizer Geoff Keighley announcing today that the show reached 171 million global livestreams. That's up 11% from 154 million in 2024 and makes the 2025 show the "most watched TGA in history." Keighley also states that conversations about TGA on X were up 12% and that the show had 23,000 co-streams across Twitch and YouTube, which was up 50% year-over-year. The new streaming viewership numbers do not count views on Prime Video, Variety reported. This year's Super Bowl, meanwhile, reached 127.7 million viewers. The comparison is not 1:1, however, for many reasons. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Meta Quest 3S VR Headset Drops To $250, Includes $50 Amazon Gift Card
description: Meta Quest 3S 128GB: Gorilla Tag Bundle + $50 Amazon Credit $250 (was $300) | Amazon Exclusive Get deal at Amazon Meta Quest 3S 256GB: Batman Bundle + $49 Amazon Credit $349 (was $400) Get deal at Amazon The Meta Quest 3S 128GB model is back on sale for its Black Friday price. For a limited time, you can get the best entry-level VR headset for $250 (was $300) and get a free $50 Amazon credit to spend on a future transaction. Simply click "redeem" on the store page or enter promo code QUEST3S50 at checkout to claim the Amazon credit. This particular Quest 3S 128GB edition is exclusive to Amazon and comes with in-game content for the popular multiplayer game Gorilla Tag. Alternatively, you can upgrade to the Meta Quest 3S 256GB Batman Bundle for $349 (was $400). This bundle includes Batman: Arkham Shadow ($50 value) and $49 Amazon Credit to use on a future purchase. Amazon is once again price-matching Best Buy with these deals--though Best Buy's 128GB bundle comes with The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners ($20 value). Amazon is also offering a $50 credit with the purchase of the higher-end Meta Quest 3, and the PlayStation VR 2 for PS5 and PC is on sale for $299 (was $400) through December 18. Continue Reading at GameSpot
